required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Benefits of Near Infrared Autofluorescence (NIRAF) Detection for Identifying Parathyroid Glands During Total Thyroidectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Benefits of Near Infrared Autofluorescence (NIRAF) Detection for Identifying Parathyroid Glands During Total Thyroidectomy

brief_summary.textblock: This study will see if the use of near infrared autofluorescence (NIRAF) detection with a 'Parathyroid Eye (PTeye)' for identifying parathyroid glands (PGs) during total thyroidectomy (TTx) is better than surgeon's detection alone. It compares risk, benefits and outcomes in TTx patients where NIRAF detection with PTeye for parathyroid identification is either used or not used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of frozen section analysis performed(By case)
Percent of frozen sections confirmed as parathyroid tissue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Frozen results collected immediately after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Permanent histology reports of all excised tissues
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Permanent histology collected after report generated by pathologist (5-7 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: History of calcium and/or Vitamin D supplementation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 month prior to surgery (including daily dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: History of calcium and/or Vitamin D supplementation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 months after surgery (including daily dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of calcium and/or Vitamin D supplementation
Duration of calcium and/or Vitamin D supplementation
Frequency of Emergency Room (ER) visits or hospitalization due to low blood calcium within 30 days of surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Number of auto-transplanted parathyroid glands if the parathyroid gland was accidentally excised/devascularized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of nights spent in the hospital after total thyroidectomy
secondary_outcome.description: Number of nights spent for postoperative recovery in the hospital after the surgical procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of inadvertently resected parathyroid glands
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate (intraoperative) to 7-10 days after total thyroidectomy (as presented in the pathology report)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of inadvertently resected parathyroid glands when parathyroid tissue is found in the resected thyroid specimens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall number of parathyroid glands identified.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall number of parathyroid glands identified (Experimental Group: Glands identified with naked eye + NIRAF; Control Group: Glands identified with naked eye)

arm_group.description: The surgeon will use the PTeye as an intraoperative tool to identify if a suspect tissue is a parathyroid or not, during the total thyroidectomy procedure.

The surgeon will not use the PTeye and will proceed with the total thyroidectomy as usual, while relying solely on her/his surgical experience in identifying the parathyroid glands during the operations.

intervention.description: The surgeon will first take 5 baseline NIRAF measurements on the thyroid gland (or neck muscle, if thyroid is absent) using the disposable sterile fiber probe that is connected to the PTeye console, as per device functionality requirements.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with thyroid disease who will be undergoing total thyroidectomy (includes patients who have undergone a prior neck exploration for parathyroid disease or other but have an intact thyroid gland).
- Patients with persisting thyroid disease and will be undergoing re-operative or completion thyroidectomy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Patients with concurrent parathyroid and thyroid disease
- Patients with incidental enlarged parathyroid discovered during thyroidectomy procedure.
- Patients undergoing thyroid lobectomy or partial thyroidectomy

responsible_party.investigator_title: Ambulatory Care Clinical Chief, William J Fry Professor of Surgery and Professor of Surgery, Medical School
